import React from 'react' import { MDXTag } from '@mdx-js/tag' import { Playground, PropsTable } from 'docz' import { Button, ButtonIcon, ButtonSkeleton } from '../src/components/Button/' const layoutProps = { }; export default class MDXContent extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.layout = null } render() { const { components, ...props } = this.props return {`Button`} {`import { Button, ButtonIcon, ButtonSkeleton } from '../src/components/Button/'`} {`Introduction`} {`Buttons express what action will occur when the user clicks or touches it. Buttons are used to initialize an action, either in the background or foreground of an experience. Use the `}{`\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Secondary Button`} {`Use for secondary actions on each page.`} \n Click me\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Ghost Button`} {`Use when an action does not require primary dominance on the page. Ghost buttons require a glyph icon (cannot be stand alone text because of poor affordance).`} \n Click me{\' \'}\n \n \n \n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Danger Button`} {`Use when an action has harmful intentions to the users data (delete, remove, etc).`} \n Click me\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Outline Button`} {`TODO: Put a description here`} \n Click me\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Disabled Button`} {`Use when the user cannot proceed until an input is collected. I’m not sure whether it’s ok to grey out the button instead of just fading the opacity. Keep in mind that disabled buttons exclude users with disabilities. It’s one of the best reasons to stop using them. The best practice is to keep the button enabled. Let the user click the button and then show the message why it can’t proceed.`}
{` More on this: `}{`https://axesslab.com/disabled-buttons-suck/`} \n Click me\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Icon Button`} {`When words are not enough, icons can be used in buttons to better communicate what the button does. Icons are always paired with text for UX. The icon size must always be `}{`16px/1rem`}{` and the whole size need to have at least `}{`48px x 48px (3rem)`}{` in mobile.`} \n \n \n \n\n\n \n \n \n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Link`} {`Link with button style. Links are used primarily as a navigational element. Links may also change what or how data is displayed (view more, show all, etc). If the action taken by the user will change or manipulate data, use a button.`} \n Click me\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Button Size`} {`TODO: Put a description here.`} \n Click me\n\n\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Button Full Width`} {`TODO: Put a description here.`} \n Click me\n\n\n'} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> {`Button Skeleton`} {`TODO: Put a description here.`} '} __scope={{props: this ? this.props : props,Button,ButtonIcon,ButtonSkeleton}}> } }
